intro: Capnites brevidens, commonly known as the narrow-leaved capnite, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, fern-like leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette. Its flowers are small and white, clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Capnites brevidens is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
